intro: Stenandrium gabonicum, commonly known as the Gabon flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite and simple, with a glossy green surface. The bark is smooth and grayish, often exuding a milky sap when damaged.
